summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the in-person pretrial conference in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the date, location, COVID-19 protocols, and public access arrangements for the conference scheduled for November 1, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this pretrial conference is being scheduled.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge who issued this order scheduling the pretrial conference and outlining the access protocols.

events.title: In-Person Pretrial Conference
events.description: An in-person pretrial conference scheduled for 11:00 a.m. in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: The court scheduled an in-person pretrial conference for November 1, 2021, in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Access was to be provided for alleged victims and members of the defendant's family, with public access via overflow courtrooms due to COVID-19 protocols.
Strict COVID-19 protocols were mandated for courthouse entry, including a health questionnaire, temperature check, and mask requirements.
